p: Essential oil is the most important and the most frequently investigated product of hyssop. Available literature data on wild and cultivated plants indicate that its herb yields 0.3–1% of essential oil with isopinocamphone as the dominant compound, along with pinocamphone, β-pinene, 1,8-cineole, pinocarvone, linalool, sabinene and methyl eugenol [ 7, 8, 9]. Beside the essential oil, hyssop herb contains flavonoids and phenolic acids, tannins, diterpene lactones (marrubiin) and triterpenoid compounds such as ursolic and oleanolic acid [ 5, 7, 10].
